findings.title: Integer under/overflow vulnerability
findings.description: Arithmetic operation may cause integer underflow or overflow.

findings.title: Floating Point and Rounding Accuracy
findings.description: Vulnerability related to floating point and rounding accuracy issues in arithmetic operations.

findings.title: Manager functions for emergency handle
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Crucial function and data access
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Count of calling important task, contract state change, intentional task delay
findings.description: The finding suggests potential issues with the count of calling important tasks, changes to the contract state, and intentional delays. This could lead to unintended behavior or security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Unexpected revert handling
findings.description: The finding indicates potential issues with revert handling mechanisms within smart contracts.

findings.title: Gas limit excess due to unpredictable implementation
findings.description: The contract's gas limit can be exceeded due to an unpredictable implementation, potentially leading to a denial of service.

findings.title: Dependency on the block number or timestamp
findings.description: The contract relies on the block number or timestamp which can be manipulated by miners.

findings.title: Frontrunning
findings.description: Vulnerability related to Miner Manipulation where a malicious actor can manipulate the order of transactions to their advantage.

findings.title: Proper use of Check-Effect-Interact pattern
findings.description: Ensuring the correct implementation of the Check-Effect-Interact pattern to prevent potential security issues.

findings.title: Prevention of state change after external call
findings.description: This finding highlights the importance of preventing state changes after making an external call to ensure the contract's integrity and prevent potential reentrancy attacks.

findings.title: Error handling and logging
findings.description: Improper error handling and logging mechanisms can lead to unforeseen consequences and security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Code injection using delegatecall
findings.description: Potential vulnerability allowing unauthorized code execution through delegatecall.

findings.title: Inappropriate use of assembly code
findings.description: The contract uses assembly code in an inappropriate manner.

findings.title: Deviate from standards that can be an obstacle of interoperability
findings.description: The code does not follow standard conventions which may hinder compatibility with other contracts or systems.

findings.title: Lack of validation on inputs
findings.description: The functions _verifyTransferFeeTokenVM, verifyCompleteRemoteAssetVM, and verifyGovernanceVM do not properly validate user input, which can lead to unauthorized access or malicious activities.

findings.title: Unintended execution leads to error
findings.description: Logic Error/Bug: Unintended execution leads to error.

findings.title: Coherency between the documented spec and implementation
findings.description: Inconsistency between the documentation specification and the actual implementation of the smart contract.

findings.title: Variable and function visibility setting
findings.description: Incorrect variable and function visibility settings can lead to unauthorized access or data manipulation.

findings.title: Contract interface is properly implemented on code
findings.description: The contract interface is correctly implemented in the provided code.
